meanings.definition: Represented in human form or with human characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The cartoon character was personified with a big smile and friendly eyes.
meanings.sent2: The painting of the queen was personified with a crown and elegant dress.
meanings.sent3: The toy bear was personified with a cute bow tie and a friendly wave.
meanings.sent4: The tree in the story was personified with arms reaching out like welcoming branches.
meanings.sent5: The robot in the movie was personified with blinking lights and a cheerful voice.

meanings.definition: Embodied or exemplified in a person.
meanings.sent1: Her kindness was personified in the way she helped everyone in need.
meanings.sent2: His bravery was personified when he stood up to the bully at school.
meanings.sent3: Their teamwork was personified during the group project when they all worked together seamlessly.
meanings.sent4: The spirit of generosity was personified by the anonymous donor who gave to charity.
meanings.sent5: The essence of leadership was personified by the captain of the team who inspired others to do their best.

meanings.definition: To attribute human qualities to something non-human.
meanings.sent1: In the fairy tale, the animals were personified and could talk and dance.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Greeks often personified natural elements like the sun and the moon.
meanings.sent3: The old car seemed to be personified, making funny noises like it was laughing.
meanings.sent4: The wind was personified as a mischievous trickster, playing with the leaves in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The mountain was personified in the legend as a sleeping giant, waiting to awaken.
